definitions.definition: a coin of the US and Canada worth ten cents
very common and therefore not valuable
to tell the police or people in authority that somebody has done something wrong

examples.text: If he finds out who dropped the dime on him, they're in trouble.
I'm worried if I drop a dime on them, they'll get fired, which I don't think they really deserve.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French disme, from Latin decima pars ‘tenth part’. The word originally denoted a tithe or tenth part; the modern sense ‘ten cent coin’ dates from the late 18th cent.
